title: Definitions
context: [ยง255D-2] Definitions. The definitions in this section apply throughout this chapter unless the context clearly requires otherwise. &ldquo;Agreement&rdquo; means the streamlined sales and use tax agreement as adopted. &ldquo;Certified automated system&rdquo; means software certified jointly by the states that are signatories to the agreement to calculate the tax imposed by each jurisdiction on a transaction, determine the amount of tax to remit to the appropriate state, and maintain a record of the transaction. &ldquo;Certified service provider&rdquo; means an agent who performs all of the seller&rsquo;s sales tax functions and is certified jointly by the states that are signatories to the agreement. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of taxation. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means an individual, trust, estate, fiduciary, partnership, limited liability company, limited liability partnership, corporation, or any other legal entity. &ldquo;Sales tax&rdquo; means the general excise tax levied under chapter 237. &ldquo;Seller&rdquo; means any person making sales, leases, or rentals of personal property or services. &ldquo;State&rdquo; means any state of the United States and the District of Columbia. &ldquo;Use tax&rdquo; means the use tax levied under chapter 238.
